name: Moo
description: The most basic move in Moo. Passes the Moo one person to the left or right in the direction of play. This move must be made in the same direction as the Moo is currently traveling.

name: Cowpat
description: Reflects the Moo backwards, reversing the direction of play. Passes the Moo one person to the left or right of the user in the new direction of play. The move must be made using the furthest hand from the direction of play.

name: Cream Tea
description: Skips the person who would go next in the current direction of travel.

name: Manure
description: Summons magical dog

name: Gimme My Combine Harvester
description: Summons magical dog

name: Mmm Burger
description: Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm burger

name: You're A Nice Man
description: Summons magical hah dog

name: You're Not A Nice Man
description: Jumps to that player and changes direction

name: Take The Plough
description: Summons haha a magical dog hahahahahyaha

name: Pitchfork
description: We all know what these do Phil

name: Tutenkharghhhhmoon
description: Micah it summons a magical dog pal.

name: Combovine
description: Conjoins two Moos incident on the player into a single Moo traveling to Egypt (where Hunter00 lives).

name: Moon
description: Sends moo to moon.

name: Mooteor Shower
description: Can only be used when 10 Moos are on the moon.

name: Tractors On
description: Does what it says on the tin.

name: Tractors Off Time For Tea
description: Same as Tractors On but off.

name: Crop Circles
description: A crop circle, crop formation, or corn circle is a pattern created by flattening a crop, usually a cereal. The term was first coined in the early 1980s by Colin Andrews. Crop circles have been described as all falling 'within the range of the sort of thing done in hoaxes' by Taner Edis, professor of physics at Truman State University. Although obscure natural causes or alien origins of crop circles are suggested by fringe theorists, there is no scientific evidence for such explanations, and all crop circles are consistent with human causation. The number of reports of crop circles has substantially increased since the 1970s. There has been scant scientific study of them. Circles in the United Kingdom are not distributed randomly across the landscape but appear near roads, areas of medium to dense population and cultural heritage monuments, such as Stonehenge or Avebury. In 1991, two hoaxers, Doug Bower and Dave Chorley, took credit for having created many circles throughout England after one of their circles was described by an investigator as impossible for human beings to make. Formations are usually created overnight, although some are reported to have appeared during the day. In contrast to crop circles or crop formations, archaeological remains can cause cropmarks in the fields in the shapes of circles and squares, but they do not appear overnight, and they are always in the same places every year. Nearly half of all crop circles found in the UK in 2003 were located within a 15 kilometres (9.3 mi) radius of the Avebury stone circles.

name: UFO Sighting
description: A UFO is sighted granting sight to all players.

name: Mootilated Corpse
description: Please press F to pay respects.

name: Pew
description: Say pew.

name: Murder Moostry
description: Must be used if you know you have been "Pew"ed.

name: Retractor
description: Reverses two moves time.

name: Simoon Says
description: Do what Simoon says you should until the Moo lands back on Simoon.

name: Moot Point
description: Shhhhhhhhhh

name: Newt Point
description: Does what it says on the tin.

name: Stir The Pot
description: All plough relationships are rotated one person in the direction of travel of the relevant moo.

name: Fish
description: üê†

name: Surf 'n' Turf
description: Like steak and fishy.

name: Ocean Trawler
description: The under-the-sea equivalent of Tractors On.

name: All Hail The Moo King
description: The target player becomes the new moonarch. This entails the target player placing a crown upon their head as all players say "All hail". From now on, all moves by players that result in the moo ending up on the moonarch must be completed with the phrase "your majesty".
